title: Function Overloading
subject: C++ Programming
theory:
Same function name, different parameters. 
Compiler decides which one to call based on arguments (Static Polymorphism).

common_mistakes.correction: Return type is NOT part of function signature. `int f()` and `void f()` cannot coexist.

interview_questions.question: How does compiler handle overloading?
interview_questions.answer: Name Mangling. It renames functions internally (e.g., `_Z3addii` for int, `_Z3adddd` for double).
